data.title: Microsoft's $68.7 billion Activision deal came as a surprise but won't constrain other opportunities, investor says
data.description: A controversy over misconduct at Activision Blizzard made the publisher more affordable. It could help Microsoft win more game subscribers, an investor said.

data.title: Activision looked at topping Take-Two's $12.7 billion offer for Zynga, but sold to Microsoft instead
data.description: Activision Blizzard recently contacted an advisor to consider topping Take-Two's $12.7 billion bid for Zynga, according to a person familiar with the matter.

data.author: Dina Bass
data.title: Microsoft Buys Activision Blizzard in $69 Billion Game Deal
data.description: Microsoft Buys Activision Blizzard in $69 Billion Game Deal

data.title: Federal antitrust enforcers are considering updating corporate merger guidelines
data.description: The Federal Trade Commission and US Justice Department's Antitrust Division on Tuesday announced a joint review of federal guidelines for corporate mergers to consider whether they should be updated "to better detect and prevent illegal, anticompetitive deals."

data.author: Ben Scent
data.title: Microsoft Splurges on Biggest Cash Takeover of the Pandemic
data.description: Microsoft Splurges on Biggest Cash Takeover of the Pandemic

data.title: Microsoft's $68.7 billion deal for Activision once again shows big tech's dominance over legacy media
data.description: Microsoft takes big $68.7 billion swing on video game company Activision Blizzard while legacy media stays on sidelines

data.title: Microsoft to acquire Activision Blizzard in $68.7 billion deal
data.description: Microsoft announced plans to acquire Activision Blizzard, the video game company behind blockbuster hits like "Warcraft," "Overwatch" and "Call of Duty," in an all-cash transaction valued at $68.7 billion. Microsoft says that the move will make the company the third-largest gaming company by revenue, after Tencent and Sony.

data.title: Activision shares soar 37% on report Microsoft will buy the video game giant
data.description: Activision shares soar 37% on report Microsoft will buy the video game giant

data.title: U.S. stock futures are little changed ahead of more earnings reports
data.description: U.S. stock futures were little changed Monday night as traders braced for the latest batch of corporate earnings reports.
